Dear Bill:
Sorry I had to leave the meeting so soon. I must repeat
however that inviting Jack as a speaker, re-opening the
question of the Board*s action on Production and exhibit¬
ing a generally weak attitude toward those who (as re¬
cently as Rome) have sworn to completely destroy the
NAEB seems to me to be a poor, poor way to conduct the
NAEB*s business.
If the results of this are what I believe they surely
will be, then KTCA-TV may well have to reconsider its
whole position vis-a-vis the NAEB, including the pro¬
vision of memberships to its personnel, its own member¬
ship and its efforts to support the organization by work
and occasionally by Foundation grants.
In short, the NAEB I want KTCA-TV to be associated with
is the one where Hull could quote eloquently from "Exodus"
and fire a roomful of the previously indifferent with
enthusiasm - the one which (when Jim Robertson told
Skornia the NAEB should not run the Washington Conference
because "the affiliates have a low opinion of the NAEB")
thbugh Skornia told Robertson to mind his own business
and held the Conference.
I am not much interested in belonging to anoorganization
which seems determined to commit suicide and quakes because
John Crabbe’s station is too broke to pay its dues. Such
an organization would leave me too indifferent to support
either financially or in terms of effort.
